Tooltip_FilterEnabled_Description: Click to show settings for all Windows versions
Settings_BackupRestore_Description: Import or export your Winhance configuration
Dialog_ItemsWillBeInstalled:
These items will be installed.
Do you want to continue?
Dialog_ItemsWillBeRemoved:
These items will be removed.
Do you want to continue?
Dialog_ItemsWillBeProcessed:
These items will be {0}ed.
Do you want to continue?
Dialog_SaveRemovalScripts: Save removal scripts to ensure continuous removal
Dialog_Donation_Header_Message: If you found this tool helpful, please consider making a small donation to support development.
Dialog_Donation_SupportMessage: Your support helps keep this project going!
Dialog_Update_Message: Good News! A New Version of Winhance is available.
Dialog_Update_Footer: Would you like to download and install the update now?
Dialog_Update_NoUpdates_Message: You have the latest version of Winhance.
Dialog_Update_CheckError_Message: An error occurred while checking for updates: {0}
Dialog_ImportConfig_Option_Own_Descripti: Select a configuration file from your computer
Dialog_ImportConfig_Option_Defaults_Desc: Reset all settings to Windows factory defaults
Dialog_ImportOptions_Message: Choose how you would like to import a configuration:
Dialog_Unified_Description_SoftwareAndAp: Selections for Windows Packages and External Software
Dialog_Unified_Option_ApplyWallpaper: Apply default wallpaper for selected theme
Dialog_Unified_Option_CleanTaskbar: Apply clean Taskbar (Removes all pinned items from the Taskbar)
Dialog_Unified_Option_CleanStartMenu: Apply clean Start Menu (Removes all pinned items and applies clean layout)
Dialog_Unified_Error_NoSelection: Please select at least one section to continue.
Dialog_Unified_Description_Import: Select which settings from the config file you want to apply to your computer.
Config_Export_Success_Message:
Your config has been saved to:
{0}
Config_Import_Status_Applying: Sit back, relax and watch while Winhance enhances Windows with your desired settings...
Config_Import_Success_Message: Your configuration has been applied successfully.
Config_Import_Error_NoSelection: Please select at least one section to import.
Config_Backup_NotFound: No backup configuration files were found. A backup is automatically created on first app launch.
Review_Mode_Description: Review the changes across all sections, then click Apply Config when ready.
Review_Mode_Cancel_Confirmation: Are you sure you want to cancel? No changes will be applied.
Review_Mode_Select_Action: Select an action (Install or Uninstall) for checked apps using the buttons above
Review_Mode_Action_Install: Checked apps will be installed when you apply the config
Review_Mode_Action_Remove: Checked apps will be removed when you apply the config
Review_Mode_Action_ThemeWallpaper: Apply the default wallpaper for this theme?
Review_Mode_Action_CleanTaskbar: Clean the taskbar as part of this configuration?
Review_Mode_Action_CleanStartMenu: Clean the start menu as part of this configuration?
Common_NoSearchResults: No settings found matching your search. Try different keywords.
Category_Customize_StatusText: Customize Your Windows Appearance and Behaviour
Category_SoftwareApps_StatusText: Manage Windows Apps and Install Software
Setting_windows-pushnotifications_Descri: Get notifications from apps and other senders in Windows
Setting_notifications-sound_Description: Play audio alerts when notifications arrive from apps and system senders
Setting_notifications-toast-above-lock_N: Show notifications on the lock screen
Setting_notifications-toast-above-lock_D: Display toast notifications on the lock screen when your device is locked
Setting_notifications-critical-toast-abo: Show reminders and incoming VoIP calls on the lock screen
Display critical notifications like reminders and VoIP calls when your device is locked
Setting_notifications-show-bell-icon_Des: Display the notification bell icon in the system tray
Setting_notifications-welcome-experience: Show the Windows welcome experience after updates
Show what's new and suggested after updates and when signed in
Setting_notifications-system-setting-eng: Suggest ways to get the most out of Windows and finish setting up this device
Show suggestions to help you complete device setup and optimize Windows features
Setting_notifications-tips-suggestions_N: Get tips and suggestions when using Windows
Setting_notifications-tips-suggestions_D: Show helpful tips and suggestions while using Windows
Setting_notifications-system-pane-sugges: Display helpful suggestions in the Action Center and Notification Center
Setting_notifications-capability-access_: Show notifications when apps request access to system capabilities and permissions
Setting_notifications-startup-app_Descri: Show notifications when apps are added to your Windows startup list
Setting_notifications-app-location-reque: Show notifications when apps attempt to access your location information
Setting_notifications-clock-change_Descr: Show notifications when daylight saving time changes occur
Setting_notifications-windows-security_D: Show all notifications from Windows Security about threats, scans, and protection status
Setting_notifications-security-maintenan: Show notifications from the Security and Maintenance Action Center
Setting_security-uac-level_Description: Controls UAC notification level and secure desktop behavior
Setting_security-uac-level_Option_2: Notify when apps try to make changes
Setting_security-uac-level_Option_3: Notify when apps try to make changes (no dim)
Setting_security-workplace-join-messages: Blocks the 'Allow my organization to manage my device' and 'No, sign in to this app only' pop-up messages
Setting_start-menu-clean-10_Description: Removes all pinned items and applies clean layout
Setting_start-menu-clean-10_ConfirmMessa:
You are about to clean the Start Menu for all users on this computer. This will remove all pinned items and apply the recommended layout.

Do you want to continue?
Setting_start-menu-clean-10_ConfirmCheck:
Also apply recommended Start Menu settings to disable
suggestions, recommendations, and tracking features.
Setting_start-menu-clean-11_Description: Removes all pinned items and applies clean layout
Setting_start-menu-clean-11_ConfirmMessa:
You are about to clean the Start Menu for all users on this computer. This will remove all pinned items and apply the recommended layout.

Do you want to continue?
Setting_start-menu-clean-11_ConfirmCheck:
Also apply recommended Start Menu settings to disable
suggestions, recommendations, and tracking features.
Setting_start-menu-layout_Description: Choose whether the Start Menu shows more pinned apps, more recommendations, or a balanced default layout
Setting_start-recommended-section_Descri: Show or hide the lower section that displays recently opened files and suggested apps
Setting_start-show-all-pins-by-default_D: Automatically expand to show all pinned apps instead of requiring you to click 'All apps'
Setting_start-show-recently-added-apps_D: Display a list of recently installed applications at the top of the All Apps list
Setting_start-show-frequent-list_Descrip: Display your frequently launched applications at the top of the All Apps list for quick access
Setting_start-track-progs_Description: Display your frequently launched applications at the top of the All Apps list for quick access
Setting_start-show-suggestions_Descripti: Display app suggestions and promotional content from the Microsoft Store in the Start Menu
Setting_start-show-recommended-files_Nam: Show recommended files and recently opened items
Setting_start-show-recommended-files_Des: Display your recently opened documents and files in the Start Menu's Recommended section for quick access
Setting_start-menu-recommendations_Name: Show recommendations for tips, shortcuts, new apps, and more
Setting_start-menu-recommendations_Descr: Display personalized suggestions from Windows for tips, app shortcuts, and Microsoft Store apps in the Recommended section
Setting_start-show-account-notifications: Display notifications about Microsoft account sign-in, sync status, and account-related suggestions
Setting_start-disable-bing-search-result: Prevent web results from Bing from appearing when searching in the Start Menu, showing only local files and apps
Setting_theme-mode-windows_Description: Choose between Light and Dark mode for Windows and apps
Setting_theme-mode-windows_ConfirmMessag:
You are about to apply {themeMode} to Windows and apps.
Do you want to continue?
Setting_theme-transparency_Description: Enable translucent effects for the Start Menu, taskbar, and other Windows interface elements
Setting_taskbar-clean_Description: Removes all pinned items from the Taskbar
Setting_taskbar-clean_ConfirmMessage:
You are about to clean the Taskbar for the current user.

This will remove all pinned items from the Taskbar.

Do you want to continue?
Setting_taskbar-search-box-11_Descriptio: Choose how the Windows search appears on your taskbar: hidden, icon only, icon with label, or full search box
Setting_taskbar-search-box-10_Descriptio: Choose how the Windows search appears on your taskbar: hidden, icon only, or full search box
Setting_taskbar-alignment_Description: Align taskbar icons to the left (classic Windows style) or center (Windows 11 default)
Setting_taskbar-meet-now_Name: Remove 'Meet Now' button from system tray
Setting_taskbar-meet-now_Description: Controls Meet Now button visibility in the system tray
Setting_taskbar-system-tray-icons_Name: Always show all system tray icons
Setting_taskbar-system-tray-icons_Descri: Show all system tray icons directly on the taskbar instead of hiding them in the overflow menu (up arrow)
Setting_taskbar-task-view_Description: Show the Task View button for managing virtual desktops and viewing all open windows at once
Setting_taskbar-widgets_Description: Show the Widgets button that displays personalized news, weather, calendar, and other information
Setting_taskbar-news-and-interests_Descr: Show the News and Interests widget that displays headlines, weather, stocks, and other personalized content
Setting_taskbar-transparent_Description: Controls the transparency level of the taskbar. Winhance automatically enables Transparency Effects when this setting is applied
Setting_taskbar-small_Description: Reduce the height of the taskbar by using smaller icons, giving you more screen space
Setting_taskbar-end-task_Description: Adds an 'End Task' option when right-clicking applications on the taskbar for quick termination
Setting_explorer-customization-shortcut-: Remove '- Shortcut' suffix from new shortcuts
Prevents Windows from appending '- Shortcut' text to newly created shortcut file names
Setting_explorer-customization-context-m: Use the Windows 10-style right-click menu with all options visible instead of the simplified Windows 11 menu
Setting_explorer-take-ownership_Descript: Adds a right-click option to take ownership of files, folders, and drives with automatic permission elevation
Setting_explorer-context-menu-toggle-ext: Adds a right-click menu option to quickly toggle file extension visibility in File Explorer (only visible on the Classic Context Menu or Show More Options Menu in Windows 11)
Setting_explorer-context-menu-windows-te: Show 'Open in Windows Terminal' in Context Menu
Displays the Windows Terminal option when right-clicking folders and backgrounds in File Explorer
Setting_devices-dynamic-lighting-ambient: Use Dynamic Lighting on my devices
Allow Windows Dynamic Lighting to control ambient RGB effects on compatible devices
Setting_devices-dynamic-lighting-foregro: Compatible apps in the foreground always control lighting
Allow compatible apps to control device lighting effects
Setting_devices-default-printer-manageme: Prevents Windows from automatically changing your default printer based on location or last used printer
Setting_explorer-customization-launch-to: Choose what happens when File Explorer is opened
Setting_explorer-customization-browse-fo: Choose whether each folder opens in the same window or in its own window
Open each folder in the same window
Open each folder in its own window
Setting_explorer-customization-click-ite: Choose whether to open files and folders with a single click (like web links) or double-click (traditional)
Double-click to open an item (single-click to select)
Single-click to open (underline icon titles consistent with browser)
Single-click to open (underline icon titles only when pointing)
Setting_explorer-customization-show-rece: Displays recently accessed files and recommendations in Quick Access
Setting_explorer-customization-show-freq: Displays your most accessed folders in Quick Access section
Setting_explorer-customization-show-offi: Displays cloud files from your Office.com account in Quick Access
Setting_explorer-customization-show-thum: Displays generic file icons instead of image/document previews
Setting_explorer-customization-show-menu: Shows the Menu bar (File, Edit etc.) on all windows that support it
Setting_explorer-customization-item-spac: Reduces vertical spacing between files and folders for denser view
Setting_explorer-customization-icon-thum: Shows file type icon overlay on bottom-right corner of thumbnail previews
Setting_explorer-customization-folder-ti: Display file size information in folder tips
Shows total size and file count when hovering over folders
Setting_explorer-customization-full-path: Display the full path in the title bar
Shows complete directory path in window title instead of folder name only
Setting_explorer-customization-show-hidd: Displays items with the hidden attribute set
Setting_explorer-customization-hide-empt: Hides drives with no media inserted like empty card readers or optical drives
Setting_explorer-customization-show-file: Displays file type extensions (like .txt, .pdf) after file names
Setting_explorer-enable-photo-viewer_Des: Restore the legacy Windows Photo Viewer and set it as the default program for common image file formats
Setting_explorer-customization-hide-merg: Automatically merges folders with same name without confirmation dialog
Setting_explorer-customization-hide-prot: Displays system files marked with the SuperHidden attribute
Setting_explorer-customization-separate-: Launch folder windows in a separate process
Runs each Explorer window in its own process to prevent crashes affecting all windows
Setting_explorer-customization-persist-b: Restore previous folder windows at logon
Reopens Explorer windows that were open when you last shut down or logged off
Setting_explorer-customization-show-driv: Displays drive letters (C:, D:) before drive names in This PC
Setting_explorer-customization-compresse: Show encrypted or compressed NTFS files in color
Displays encrypted files in green and compressed files in blue
Setting_explorer-customization-popup-des: Show pop-up description for folder and desktop items
Displays tooltip with item details when hovering over files and folders
Setting_explorer-customization-preview-h: Show preview handlers in preview pane
Enables file content preview when selecting files in Explorer
Setting_explorer-customization-status-ba: Displays bar at bottom showing item count and selected file sizes
Setting_explorer-customization-disable-s: Displays cloud sync status notifications from OneDrive and other sync providers
Setting_explorer-customization-checkbox-: Use check boxes to select items
Adds checkboxes next to items for easier multi-selection
Setting_explorer-customization-sharing-w: Shows simplified sharing dialog instead of advanced security permissions
Setting_explorer-customization-typing-be: Chooses whether typing selects matching items or searches automatically
Select the typed item in the view
Automatically type into the Search Box
Setting_explorer-customization-3d-object: Display the 3D Objects folder alongside Documents, Pictures, and other default folders
Setting_explorer-customization-home-fold: Display the Home folder in the navigation pane as a shortcut to your user profile folder
Setting_explorer-customization-gallery_D: Display the Gallery folder in the navigation pane for quick access to all your photos and videos
Setting_explorer-customization-show-avai: Shows cloud sync status icons for OneDrive files in navigation pane
Setting_explorer-customization-nav-expan: Automatically expands navigation tree to highlight current folder location
Setting_explorer-customization-nav-show-: Shows all folders in the navigation pane
Displays Libraries container grouping Documents, Music, Pictures, and Videos
Setting_explorer-long-file-paths_Descrip: Enables support for file paths with up to 32,767 characters instead of the traditional 260-character limit
Setting_sound-startup_Description: Play the Windows startup sound when your computer boots up
Setting_sound-communication-ducking_Desc: Automatically lower volume of media and apps when Windows detects communication activity
Setting_sound-communication-ducking_Opti: Reduce the volume of other sounds by 80%
Reduce the volume of other sounds by 50%
Setting_sound-narrator-audio-ducking_Des: Allow Narrator to automatically lower the volume of other applications when it speaks
Setting_sound-voice-activation_Descripti: Allow apps to listen and respond to voice commands like "Hey Cortana"
Setting_sound-voice-activation-last-used: Remember and apply the most recently used voice activation configuration
Setting_sound-accessibility-activation_D: Play sounds when accessibility features like StickyKeys or FilterKeys are activated
Setting_sound-accessibility-warnings_Des: Play warning sounds when attempting to activate accessibility features or when accessibility-related events occur
Setting_updates-policy-mode_Description: Control how Windows updates are installed on your system
Setting_updates-policy-mode_Option_2: Paused for a long time (Unpause in Settings)
Setting_updates-policy-mode_OptionWarnin: WARNING: Pausing updates for a long time leaves your system vulnerable to security threats. Use at your own risk.

WARNING: Disabling updates leaves your system vulnerable to security threats and will prevent app installations from the Microsoft Store from completing until updates are enabled. Use at your own risk.
Setting_updates-policy-mode_OptionToolti: Windows default behavior - automatic updates enabled
Only install critical security updates, defer feature updates by 1 year
Pause all updates until 2051 - manually unpause in Windows Settings when needed
Completely disable Windows Update services and block all updates - NOT RECOMMENDED
Setting_updates-delivery-optimization_De: Share downloaded updates with other PCs on your network or the internet to reduce bandwidth usage
Setting_updates-latest-updates_Name: Get the latest updates as soon as they're available
Setting_updates-latest-updates_Descripti: Be among the first to get the latest non-security updates, fixes, and improvements as they roll out
Setting_updates-other-products_Name: Receive updates for other Microsoft products
Setting_updates-other-products_Descripti: Get Microsoft Office and other updates together with Windows updates
Setting_updates-restart-asap_Description: Restart as soon as possible (even during active hours) to finish updating
Setting_updates-restart-options_Descript: Prevents automatic restarts after installing updates when users are logged on
Setting_updates-notification-level_Descr: Show or hide notifications about available updates and update progress
Setting_updates-restart-notification_Nam: Notify me when a restart is required to finish updating
Setting_updates-restart-notification_Des: Show notification when your device requires a restart to finish updating
Setting_updates-metered-connection_Descr: Allow Windows to download updates when using mobile hotspots or data-limited connections
Setting_updates-driver-controls_Name: Do Not Include Drivers with Updates
Setting_updates-driver-controls_Descript: Prevent Windows from automatically downloading and installing hardware driver updates
Setting_updates-store-auto-download_Desc: Automatically download and install updates for apps from the Microsoft Store
Setting_security-bitlocker-auto-encrypti: Prevents Windows from automatically encrypting your device with BitLocker without user consent
Setting_security-wifi-sense_Description: Allow sharing WiFi passwords with contacts and automatically connecting to suggested open hotspots
Setting_security-automatic-maintenance_D: Choose if Windows should run automatic system maintenance tasks during idle time
Setting_security-error-reporting_Descrip: Choose if Windows should collect and send crash reports and error information to Microsoft
Setting_security-remote-assistance_Descr: Choose if other people can connect to your computer remotely to provide technical support
Setting_privacy-ads-promotional-master_D: Controls all advertising, suggestions, and promotional content throughout Windows
Setting_privacy-content-delivery-allowed: Allows Windows to deliver promotional content and automatically install suggested apps
Setting_privacy-subscribed-content_Descr: Enables promotional content subscriptions from Microsoft and partners throughout Windows
Setting_privacy-feature-management_Descr: Enables Windows feature management functionality for promotional features and automatic app installations
Setting_privacy-soft-landing_Description: Displays tips and notifications about Windows features as you use the operating system
Setting_privacy-oem-preinstalled-apps_De: Prevents OEM manufacturers from automatically installing bloatware apps
Setting_privacy-preinstalled-apps_Descri: Prevents Microsoft from automatically installing suggested apps
Setting_privacy-preinstalled-apps-ever_D: Disables tracking of whether pre-installed apps were ever enabled
Setting_privacy-silent-installed-apps_De: Prevents apps from being silently installed in the background
Setting_privacy-lock-screen_Description: Allows users to lock their computer using Windows+L, Start menu, or Ctrl+Alt+Del screen
Setting_privacy-rotating-lock-screen_Des: Displays rotating Windows Spotlight images on your lock screen instead of a static background
Setting_privacy-lock-screen-overlay_Name: Lock Screen Fun Facts and Tips
Setting_privacy-lock-screen-overlay_Desc: Displays fun facts, tips, and tricks as an overlay on your lock screen
Setting_privacy-lock-screen-slideshow_De: Enables slideshow option for lock screen background
Setting_privacy-advertising-id_Name: Let apps show me personalized ads by using my advertising ID
Setting_privacy-advertising-id_Descripti: Windows generates a unique advertising ID that apps use to track your activity and deliver personalized ads based on your behavior across different apps
Setting_privacy-language-list_Name: Let websites show me locally relevant content by accessing my language list
Setting_privacy-language-list_Descriptio: Allows websites to access your language preferences so they can automatically display content in your preferred language without requiring manual configuration on each site
Setting_privacy-app-launch-tracking_Name: Let Windows improve Start and search results by tracking app launches
Setting_privacy-app-launch-tracking_Desc: Windows records which apps you use most frequently to personalize your Start menu and improve search results, making your most-used apps more accessible
Setting_privacy-settings-content_Name: Show me suggested content in the Settings app
Setting_privacy-settings-content_Descrip: Microsoft displays promotional content, tips, and feature suggestions within the Windows Settings app to help you discover new features and functionality
Setting_privacy-settings-notifications_D: Shows account notifications in the Settings app, including prompts to reauthenticate, backup your device, and manage subscriptions
Setting_privacy-speech-recognition_Descr: Use your voice for apps using Microsoft's online speech recognition technology
Setting_privacy-narrator-online-services: Allow Narrator to use Microsoft cloud services for features like intelligent image descriptions and enhanced voice models
Setting_privacy-narrator-scripting_Descr: Allow Narrator to execute scripts for automation and custom functionality
Setting_privacy-inking-typing-dictionary: Uses your typing history and handwriting patterns to create a custom dictionary (turning off will clear all words in your custom dictionary)
Setting_privacy-diagnostics_Description: Send diagnostic data to Microsoft to help improve Windows and keep it secure
Setting_privacy-improve-inking-typing_De: Send optional inking and typing diagnostic data to Microsoft
Setting_privacy-tailored-experiences_Des: Let Microsoft use your diagnostic data to show personalized tips, ads and recommendations
Setting_privacy-feedback-frequency_Name: Allow Windows to ask you for feedback
Setting_privacy-feedback-frequency_Descr: Let Windows ask you to provide feedback on experiences in Windows
Setting_privacy-activity-history_Descrip: Allows you to jump back into what you were doing with apps, docs, or other activities on startup
Setting_privacy-timeline-suggestions_Des: Shows suggestions in the Windows 10 Timeline feature
Setting_privacy-search-history_Descripti: Improves search results by allowing Windows Search to store your search history locally on this device (Does not clear existing history)
Setting_privacy-search-msa-cloud_Name: Cloud Content Search for Microsoft account
Setting_privacy-search-msa-cloud_Descrip: Allow Windows Search to show results from apps and services that you are signed in to with your Microsoft account
Setting_privacy-search-aad-cloud_Name: Cloud Content Search for Work or School account
Setting_privacy-search-aad-cloud_Descrip: Allow Windows Search to show results from apps and services that you are signed in to with your work or school account
Setting_privacy-allow-cortana_Descriptio: Enables Microsoft's Cortana virtual assistant for voice commands and searches
Setting_privacy-location-services_Descri: Allows Windows and apps to access your device location for location-based features
Setting_privacy-camera-access_Descriptio: Allow apps to have camera access
Setting_privacy-microphone-access_Descri: Allow apps to have microphone access
Setting_privacy-account-info-access_Desc: Allow apps to have account info access
Setting_privacy-app-diagnostic-access_De: Allow apps to have app diagnostic access
Setting_privacy-onedrive-auto-backup_Des: Prevents OneDrive from automatically backing up important folders (Documents, Pictures, Desktop, etc.)
Setting_gaming-game-mode_Description: Optimize your PC for play by turning things off in the background
Setting_gaming-performance-explorer-mous: Adjust cursor speed based on movement velocity (mouse acceleration). Most competitive gamers disable this for consistent aiming in FPS games
Setting_gaming-performance-autostart-del: Delay startup applications by 10 seconds after boot to improve initial system responsiveness. Windows becomes usable faster, but your startup apps take longer to load
Setting_gaming-background-apps_Descripti: Allow apps to receive notifications, update data, and perform tasks even when not actively in use
Setting_gaming-storage-sense_Description: Automatically free up disk space by removing temporary files, emptying the recycle bin, and managing downloads
Setting_gaming-performance-explorer-sear: Search your entire file system instead of only indexed locations. This provides more complete results but is significantly slower than indexed search and increases disk activity
Setting_gaming-performance-wallpaper-com: Allow Windows to compress wallpapers to save disk space and improve performance. Only affects images in JPEG format.
Setting_gaming-performance-explorer-menu: Add a brief delay before displaying menus, or show them instantly for faster navigation
Setting_gaming-explorer-alt-tab-filter_D: Show only traditional open windows in Alt+Tab instead of including Microsoft Edge tabs and other Windows suggestions
Setting_gaming-win32-priority_Name: Adjust processor for best performance of
Setting_gaming-win32-priority_Descriptio: Configure how Windows allocates CPU time between foreground applications and background services
Setting_gaming-system-responsiveness_Des: Minimize background task interference by allocating more CPU time to your active game or multimedia application
Setting_gaming-cpu-priority_Description: Give games higher CPU scheduling priority to dedicate more processor time to your game
Setting_gaming-scheduling-category_Descr: Assign high-priority scheduling category to ensure games receive preferential system resource allocation
Setting_gaming-gpu-priority_Description: Give games higher GPU scheduling priority to improve graphics performance and frame rates
Setting_gaming-gpu-scheduling_Descriptio: Let your GPU manage its own memory and scheduling for reduced latency and improved performance
Setting_gaming-directx-flip-model_Descri: Reduce latency and use advanced features in compatible games by using DirectX flip presentation model
Setting_gaming-directx-vrr-optimizations: Enable VRR (G-Sync/FreeSync) optimizations for smoother gameplay on compatible monitors. Disable only if experiencing issues with VRR displays
Setting_gaming-nvidia-sharpening_Descrip: Enable legacy NVIDIA image sharpening filter for enhanced visual clarity. Only works on older NVIDIA drivers; newer drivers should use NVIDIA Control Panel sharpening instead
Setting_gaming-fullscreen-optimizations_: Allow Windows to optimize games running in fullscreen mode. Disabling can fix performance issues or stuttering in some older games that don't work well with borderless fullscreen optimization
Setting_gaming-performance-desktop-compo: Enable visual effects managed by the Desktop Window Manager. Disabling may provide minor performance gains on older hardware but will break Aero effects
Setting_gaming-network-throttling_Descri: Controls network packet rate limiting for multimedia applications. Keeping throttling enabled (default: 10 packets/ms) is recommended as it provides better DPC latency for gaming than disabling it entirely
Setting_gaming-nagle-algorithm_Descripti: Batch small network packets together before sending to improve efficiency. Disabling reduces latency for real-time online gaming but may slightly increase bandwidth usage
Setting_gaming-xbox-game-dvr_Description: Record gameplay clips and take screenshots using the Xbox Game Bar overlay. Disabling reduces CPU/GPU usage and can improve frame rates
Setting_gaming-game-bar-controller_Descr: Allow your Xbox/compatible controller to open Game Bar by pressing the Xbox button. Disable to prevent accidental Game Bar activation during gaming
Setting_gaming-game-bar-tips_Description: Show tips and hints about Game Bar features when opening the overlay. Disabling reduces distractions during gameplay
Setting_gaming-performance-background-se: Reduce the startup timeout for Windows services from 60 to 30 seconds. This can speed up boot time slightly
Setting_gaming-sysmain-service_Descripti: Preload frequently used applications into RAM for faster launch times. Automatic is recommended for HDDs, Manual or Disabled is preferred for SSDs
Setting_gaming-performance-prefetch_Desc: Preload frequently used applications and boot files into memory to speed up launches. Generally recommended for HDDs not SSDs
Setting_gaming-windows-search-service_De: Indexes files and folders for faster search results. Disabling reduces background CPU and disk activity but makes Windows Search slower
Setting_gaming-print-spooler-service_Des: Manages print jobs sent to printers. If you don't use a printer, set to Manual or Disabled to free up system resources
Setting_gaming-telemetry-service_Name: Connected User Experiences and Telemetry Service
Setting_gaming-telemetry-service_Descrip: Sends usage data and diagnostics to Microsoft. Setting to Manual or Disabled reduces background network and CPU usage
Setting_gaming-compatibility-assistant-s: Monitors programs for compatibility issues and suggests fixes. Disabling prevents compatibility prompts and saves minor system resources
Setting_gaming-error-reporting-service_D: Collects and sends crash data to Microsoft. Disabling prevents crash reporting, reduces network traffic, and improves privacy with minimal system impact
Setting_gaming-geolocation-service_Descr: Tracks your physical location for apps and services. Disabling improves privacy and prevents location tracking, but apps won't be able to use location features
Setting_gaming-retail-demo-service_Descr: Controls device activity when in retail demo mode. Safe to disable for personal computers as it only serves retail display purposes
Setting_gaming-insider-service_Descripti: Manages Windows Insider Program features and preview builds. Safe to disable if you're not participating in the Windows Insider Program
Setting_gaming-phone-service_Description: Manages telephony state on the device. Safe to disable if you don't use phone connectivity features or make calls from your PC
Setting_gaming-wallet-service_Descriptio: Provides wallet functionality for payment and NFC scenarios. Safe to disable if you don't use Microsoft Wallet features
Setting_gaming-smart-card-services_Descr: Enables smart card reader functionality for security authentication. Safe to disable if you don't use physical smart cards or card readers
Setting_gaming-maps-broker-service_Descr: Provides access to downloaded maps for applications. Set to Manual to allow map access when needed while preventing unnecessary background activity
Setting_gaming-fax-service_Description: Enables sending and receiving faxes. Safe to disable for most users as fax functionality is rarely used on modern systems
Setting_gaming-wmp-network-service_Name: Windows Media Player Network Sharing Service
Setting_gaming-wmp-network-service_Descr: Shares Windows Media Player libraries to other networked players and media devices. Safe to disable if you don't share media over your network
Setting_gaming-mixed-reality-service_Des: Runs OpenXR applications on Windows Mixed Reality devices. Safe to disable if you don't use VR or AR headsets
Setting_gaming-mobile-hotspot-service_De: Provides ability to share internet connection with other devices. Set to Manual to keep functionality available while preventing unnecessary background activity
Setting_gaming-sms-router-service_Descri: Routes SMS messages according to rules. Safe to disable if you don't use SMS features on your PC
Setting_gaming-parental-controls-service: Enables parental controls and family safety features. Safe to disable if you don't use parental control features
Setting_gaming-payments-nfc-service_Desc: Manages payments and Near Field Communication secure elements. Safe to disable if you don't use NFC payment features
Setting_gaming-spot-verifier-service_Des: Verifies potential file system corruptions. Set to Manual to allow verification when needed while reducing background activity
Setting_gaming-remote-access-manager_Des: Manages VPN and dial-up connections. Set to Manual to reduce background activity while keeping VPN functionality available when needed.
Setting_gaming-remote-access-auto_Descri: Automatically connects to remote networks when programs reference remote resources. Safe to disable if you don't use auto-connect VPN features
Setting_gaming-remote-desktop-services_D: Allows users to connect interactively to a remote computer. Set to Manual to reduce background activity while keeping Remote Desktop available.
Setting_gaming-remote-desktop-configurat: Manages Remote Desktop Services and Remote Desktop related configurations. Set to Manual to reduce background activity while keeping Remote Desktop available
Setting_gaming-remote-desktop-port-redir: Remote Desktop Services UserMode Port Redirector
Allows local device redirection for Remote Desktop connections. Safe to disable if you don't need to share local devices during Remote Desktop sessions
Setting_gaming-bits-service_Description: Transfers Windows Updates and downloads in the background. Setting to Manual allows updates to work while preventing constant background activity during gaming
Setting_gaming-xbox-auth-manager_Descrip: Provides authentication and authorization services for Xbox Live. Safe to disable if you don't use Xbox Game Pass, Microsoft Store games, or Xbox features
Setting_gaming-xbox-auth-manager_OptionW: Disabling will prevent Xbox Game Pass and Microsoft Store games from working
Setting_gaming-xbox-game-save_Descriptio: Syncs game saves to Xbox Live cloud. Only needed for Xbox Game Pass and Microsoft Store games with cloud save features
Setting_gaming-xbox-networking_Descripti: Supports Xbox Live multiplayer networking. Required for Xbox multiplayer gaming but not needed for Steam/Epic/other gaming platforms
Setting_gaming-biometric-service_Descrip: Enables fingerprint and facial recognition login via Windows Hello. Safe to disable on desktop systems without biometric hardware
Setting_gaming-touch-keyboard-service_Na: Touch Keyboard and Handwriting Panel Service
Setting_gaming-touch-keyboard-service_De: Enables touch keyboard and pen input functionality. Safe to disable on desktop systems without touchscreen or stylus
Setting_gaming-sensor-monitoring-service: Monitors various sensors like ambient light and orientation. Safe to disable on desktop systems without sensor hardware
Setting_gaming-sensor-data-service_Descr: Delivers data from a variety of sensors to applications. Safe to disable on desktop systems without sensor hardware
Setting_gaming-task-compatibility-apprai: Collects program compatibility telemetry for Windows upgrades. Works alongside the Connected User Experiences and Telemetry Service. Disable to reduce telemetry and background system activity
Setting_gaming-task-program-data-updater: Updates the program compatibility database with information about installed applications. Disable to reduce telemetry collection
Setting_gaming-task-ceip-consolidator_De: Consolidates and uploads usage data as part of the Customer Experience Improvement Program. Works with the Connected User Experiences and Telemetry Service. Disable to improve privacy
Setting_gaming-task-usb-ceip_Description: Collects USB device-related telemetry for the Customer Experience Improvement Program. Disable to reduce telemetry
Setting_gaming-task-disk-diagnostic_Desc: Collects disk diagnostic information and S.M.A.R.T. data for Microsoft. Disable to reduce background disk activity and telemetry
Setting_gaming-task-feedback-dmclient_De: Collects feedback and diagnostic data for Microsoft. Disable to improve privacy and reduce telemetry
Setting_gaming-task-feedback-dmclient-do: Downloads feedback scenarios and configuration data from Microsoft. Disable to reduce telemetry and network activity
Setting_gaming-task-error-reporting-queu: Queues crash reports and error data to send to Microsoft. Works alongside the Windows Error Reporting Service. Disable both to prevent crash data collection
Setting_gaming-task-sqm_Description: Collects software quality metrics and reliability data for Microsoft telemetry. Disable to improve privacy
Setting_gaming-task-mare-backup_Descript: Backs up Microsoft Assisted Recovery data. Disable to reduce background system activity
Setting_gaming-task-startup-app_Descript: Tracks and monitors startup applications for telemetry and diagnostics. Disable to reduce telemetry
Setting_gaming-task-pca-patch_Descriptio: Updates the Program Compatibility Assistant database. Works with the Program Compatibility Assistant Service. Disable both to prevent compatibility checking
Setting_gaming-task-maps-update_Descript: Updates offline maps data for the Windows Maps app. Disable if you don't use the Maps app to save bandwidth and storage
Setting_gaming-task-autochk-proxy_Descri: Performs disk checking operations and collects diagnostic data. Consider keeping enabled for disk health monitoring
Setting_gaming-task-family-safety_Descri: Monitors family safety settings and usage. Disable if you don't use family safety features
Setting_gaming-task-power-efficiency_Des: Analyzes system power consumption and collects energy efficiency data. Disable to reduce telemetry and background analysis
Setting_visual-effects-mode_Description: Choose how Windows displays visual effects
Setting_visual-effects-mode_Option_0: Let Windows choose what's best for my computer
Setting_ui-effects_Name: Animate controls and elements inside windows
Setting_ui-effects_Description: Enables animation effects for controls and UI elements
Setting_window-animation_Name: Animate windows when minimizing and maximizing
Setting_window-animation_Description: Shows smooth animation when windows are minimized or maximized
Setting_taskbar-animations_Description: Controls taskbar animation effects for opening, closing, and switching windows
Setting_enable-peek_Description: Allows peeking at desktop when hovering over Show Desktop button
Setting_menu-animation_Name: Fade or slide menus into view
Setting_menu-animation_Description: Animates menus when they appear using fade or slide effects
Setting_fade-tooltip_Name: Fade or slide ToolTips into view
Setting_fade-tooltip_Description: Animates tooltips when they appear using fade or slide effects
Setting_fade-menu-items_Name: Fade out menu items after clicking
Setting_fade-menu-items_Description: Fades menu items after selection before closing the menu
Setting_taskbar-thumbnails_Description: Saves thumbnail previews of taskbar windows for faster display
Setting_mouse-shadow_Description: Displays shadow effect underneath the mouse cursor
Setting_show-thumbnails_Description: Displays image and document previews instead of generic file icons
Setting_translucent-selection_Descriptio: Display a semi-transparent selection box when dragging to select multiple files or items
Setting_drag-full-windows_Description: Displays window contents when dragging instead of just an outline
Setting_combo-box-animation_Description: Animates combo boxes when they open with a sliding effect
Setting_font-smoothing_Description: Apply anti-aliasing to text for smoother, more readable fonts on screen
Setting_smooth-scroll-listboxes_Descript: Enables smooth scrolling in list boxes instead of jumping
Setting_drop-shadows_Name: Use drop shadows for icon labels on the desktop
Setting_drop-shadows_Description: Add shadow effects behind desktop icon text to improve readability against backgrounds
Setting_gaming-narrator-hotkey_Descripti: Enable the Win+Ctrl+Enter keyboard shortcut to quickly launch Windows Narrator screen reader
Setting_accessibility-stickykeys-hotkey_: Enable the keyboard shortcut to activate StickyKeys by pressing the Shift key five times
Setting_accessibility-filterkeys-hotkey_: Enable the keyboard shortcut to activate FilterKeys by holding the right Shift key for 8 seconds
Setting_accessibility-togglekeys-hotkey_: Enable the keyboard shortcut to activate ToggleKeys by holding Num Lock for 5 seconds, which plays sounds when Caps/Num/Scroll Lock are pressed
Setting_accessibility-mousekeys-hotkey_D: Enable the keyboard shortcut to activate MouseKeys, which allows using the numeric keypad to control the mouse pointer
Setting_accessibility-highcontrast-hotke: Enable the keyboard shortcut to activate High Contrast mode by pressing Left Alt + Left Shift + Print Screen
Setting_power-display-timeout_Descriptio: Specifies the period of inactivity before Windows turns off the display
Setting_power-harddisk-timeout_Descripti: Specifies the period of inactivity before Windows turns off the hard disk
Setting_internet-explorer-javascript-tim: Specifies the frequency of JavaScript timers
Setting_desktop-slideshow_Description: Allow or prevent Windows from rotating through multiple wallpaper images
Setting_wireless-power-mode_Description: Balance wireless network performance with battery life by adjusting adapter power usage
Setting_power-sleep-timeout_Description: Specifies the period of inactivity before Windows puts the computer to sleep
Setting_power-wake-timers_Description: Allow scheduled tasks and applications to wake your computer from sleep
Setting_power-hibernation-enable_Descrip: Save your session to disk and power down completely, using no battery while preserving your work
Setting_power-hibernate-timeout_Descript: Specifies the period of inactivity before Windows hibernates the computer
Setting_power-hybrid-sleep_Description: Combines sleep and hibernate by saving your session to disk while staying in low-power mode for faster wake
Setting_power-fast-startup_Description: Hibernate system state during shutdown for faster boot times (does not affect restart)
Setting_start-power-hibernate-option_Des: Display the Hibernate option in the Start Menu power button menu
Setting_usb-hub-selective-suspend-timeou: Set how long USB hubs wait idle before powering down to save energy
Setting_usb-selective-suspend_Descriptio: Allow Windows to power down individual USB ports when devices are idle to save energy
Setting_usb3-link-power-management_Descr: Control how aggressively USB 3.0 ports enter low-power states when devices are idle
Setting_intel-graphics-power-plan_Descri: Balance Intel integrated graphics performance with power consumption and battery life
Setting_power-button-action_Description: Choose what happens when you press the physical power button on your computer
Setting_sleep-button-action_Description: Choose what happens when you press the dedicated sleep button on your keyboard or computer
Setting_lid-close-action_Description: Choose what happens when you close your laptop lid
Setting_pci-link-state-power-management_: Control power savings for PCIe devices like graphics cards, SSDs, and expansion cards
Setting_processor-min-state_Description: Set the lowest CPU speed allowed as a percentage of maximum frequency
Setting_processor-max-state_Description: Set the highest CPU speed allowed as a percentage of maximum frequency
Setting_system-cooling-policy_Descriptio: Choose whether to slow down the processor first (passive) or speed up fans first (active) when hot
Setting_processor-performance-boost-mode: Control how aggressively your CPU boosts above base frequency for demanding tasks
Setting_processor-performance-increase-p: Control how quickly CPU ramps up speed when workload increases (for legacy non-HWP processors)
Setting_processor-performance-decrease-p: Control how quickly CPU reduces speed when workload decreases (for legacy non-HWP processors)
Setting_processor-core-parking-min-cores: Set the minimum percentage of CPU cores that must remain active and responsive
Setting_processor-core-parking-max-cores: Set the maximum percentage of CPU cores allowed to be active (100% for best performance)
Setting_processor-energy-performance-pre: Balance power efficiency and performance for modern CPUs with HWP (0 = max performance, 100 = max efficiency)
Setting_processor-performance-increase-t: Set CPU usage percentage that triggers speed increase (lower = more responsive, for legacy non-HWP CPUs)
Setting_processor-performance-decrease-t: Set CPU usage percentage that triggers speed reduction (lower = maintains performance longer, for legacy non-HWP CPUs)
Setting_power-throttling_Description: Automatically reduces CPU performance for background processes to improve battery life and reduce heat generation
Setting_multimedia-when-sharing-media_De: Control whether your PC can sleep while streaming media to other devices on your network
Setting_multimedia-video-playback-qualit: Prioritize smooth video playback over battery life when watching videos
Setting_multimedia-when-playing-video_De: Balance video quality and power consumption during video playback
Setting_critical-battery-notification_De: Show notification when battery reaches critically low level
Setting_critical-battery-action_Descript: Choose what happens when battery reaches critically low level
Setting_low-battery-level_Description: Set the battery percentage that triggers low battery warnings and actions
Setting_critical-battery-level_Descripti: Set the battery percentage that triggers critical battery warnings and emergency actions
Setting_low-battery-notification_Descrip: Show notification when battery reaches low battery level
Setting_low-battery-action_Description: Choose what happens when battery reaches low battery level
Setting_reserve-battery-level_Descriptio: Set battery percentage reserved to protect battery health and prevent unexpected shutdowns
Setting_amd-power-slider-overlay_Descrip: Balance AMD laptop performance and battery life with quick power mode selection
Setting_ati-powerplay-setting_Descriptio: Control power management for older AMD Radeon graphics cards
Setting_switchable-graphics-gpu-preferen: Choose between integrated GPU for battery life or dedicated GPU for performance in hybrid graphics laptops
Setting_start-power-lock-option_Descript: Display the Lock option in the Start Menu power button menu
Setting_start-power-sleep-option_Descrip: Display the Sleep option in the Start Menu power button menu
Error_NoInternetConnection: No internet connection. Please connect and try again.
Error_WinGetInstallFailed: Failed to install WinGet. Please check your internet connection.
Error_WinGetNotAvailable: WinGet is not available on this system.
PowerPlan_PowerSaver_Description: Delivers reduced performance which may increase power savings.
PowerPlan_Balanced_Description: Automatically balances performance and power consumption according to demand.
PowerPlan_HighPerformance_Description: Delivers maximum performance at the expense of higher power consumption.
PowerPlan_UltimatePerformance_Descriptio: Provides ultimate performance on higher end PCs.
PowerPlan_WinhancePowerPlan_Description: Ultimate Performance with Winhance-optimized settings for maximum performance.

WIMUtil_Card_CustomDrivers_Description: Select a folder that contains drivers that you want to add to the installation media

WIMUtil_Label_PerfNote_Esd: Creates larger ISO but faster Windows installation

Startup_Backup_Intro: Winhance has protected your system before making any changes.
Startup_Backup_RestoreEnabled: System Restore was disabled and has been enabled.
Startup_Backup_RestorePoint: • System Restore Point: 'Winhance Initial Restore Point'
Startup_Backup_ConfigBackup: • Configuration Backup: A snapshot of your current Windows settings
Startup_Backup_ToRestore: To undo changes made by Winhance:
Startup_Backup_RestoreInstructions_Resto: • System Restore: Search 'Create a restore point' in Windows Settings
Startup_Backup_RestoreInstructions_Confi: • Backup Config: Use Import Config in the title bar and select 'Import Backup Config'
Startup_Backup_Note: Note: System Restore will undo system-level changes. The backup config will restore your Windows settings to their original values.
Startup_Backup_Checkbox_DontCreate: Don't create restore points or backup configs in the future
Startup_Migration_Intro: Winhance has updated the location of Windows App removal scripts.
Startup_Migration_AppsStayRemoved: Windows apps you previously removed will stay removed
Startup_Migration_MayReinstall: Microsoft may reinstall some apps via Windows Updates
Startup_Migration_Recommendation: We recommend that you re-run app removal using the new version of Winhance as the new scripts are more reliable and work better.
Startup_Migration_OneTime: This notification will only appear once
Filter_Dialog_Message:
This filter controls which settings are visible in Winhance and included in export operations:

 Filter ON (Default):
  - Shows only settings compatible with your Windows version
  - Exports settings for your Windows version only

 Filter OFF:
  - Shows ALL settings (Windows 10 + 11)
  - Exports cross-version settings (for both Windows 10 + 11)

Use this when creating Winhance config or autounattend.xml files that need to work across different Windows versions or if you need to toggle a setting that is related to the other Windows version.

Do you want to toggle the filter?
Config_Unsupported_Message:
This configuration file (version {0}) is not compatible with the current version of Winhance.

Why is this happening?
Winhance has moved to a more robust configuration format to provide better functionality and reliability.

What should you do?
 Configure Winhance with your preferred settings manually
 Export a new configuration file
 This new file will work with current and future versions of Winhance

We apologize for the inconvenience. Going forward, configuration files will remain compatible across versions.
Help_WindowsApps_Content:
Click on an active Winhance removal status icon above to delete the script and task associated with it.

App Removals:
Select the item(s) you don't want on your PC (even not installed items) and remove them. Windows might try to add them back later, but Winhance will keep removing them for you if the scripts and scheduled tasks are active.

App Installations:
Select the item(s) you want to install and click on the 'Install Selected Items' button to start the installation.
(Note: Only some apps can be reinstalled, see the indicator next to each item)

Use the Search Box to find items quickly.
The Save and Import Config buttons in the main window help you manage your preferred selections.
Help_ExternalApps_Content:
Select the item(s) you want to install and click on the 'Install Selected Items' button to start the installation.

Use the Search Box to find items quickly.
The Save and Import Config buttons in the main window help you manage your preferred selections.

Tip: Install UniGetUI from the 'Other Utilities' group if you require a Software Manager as Winhance only provides external app installations, not updates and management.
Status_PleaseWait: Please wait while the application loads...
Common_RestartRequired: System restart required for changes to take effect
Compatibility_Windows10Only: This setting applies to Windows 10 only
Compatibility_Windows11Only: This setting applies to Windows 11 only
Compatibility_MaxBuild: Only compatible with Windows build {0} or lower
Msg_GenerateXmlConfirm:
You can generate an autounattend.xml file to add to a Windows ISO to customize Windows during installation based on your selections in Winhance.

How this works:
 Apps selected on the Windows Apps screen will be uninstalled automatically
 Settings in the Optimize and Customize screens will be added according to their current state in Winhance

If you're sure your selections are correct you can continue.
If not, hit no, review your app and setting selections, and come back here.

Do you want to generate the XML file and add it to the media?
WIMUtil_Msg_ValidationComplete: The selected directory contains valid Windows ISO files. You can proceed to the next step.
WIMUtil_Msg_InvalidDirectory:
The selected directory is not valid:

 It might be a mounted ISO file (must be extracted to a real folder)
 It might be read-only or on a CD/DVD drive
 It might not contain the required 'sources' and 'boot' folders

Please extract the ISO contents to a writable folder on your hard drive first.
WIMUtil_Msg_ExtractionComplete: ISO has been extracted successfully. You can now proceed to the next step.
WIMUtil_Msg_ExtractionFailed: Failed to extract ISO. Please check that the ISO file is valid and you have sufficient disk space.

There is not enough space on drive {0} to extract the ISO.

Required: {1} GB
Available: {2} GB
Needed: {3} GB more

Please free up space or select another location with more free space.
WIMUtil_Msg_InsufficientSpace_Create:
There is not enough space on drive {0} to create the ISO.

Required: {1} GB
Available: {2} GB
Needed: {3} GB more

WIMUtil_Msg_InsufficientSpace_Convert:
There is not enough space on drive {0} to convert the image.

Required: {1} GB
Available: {2} GB
Needed: {3} GB more

Please free up space or select a different location.

WIMUtil_Msg_XmlValidAddFailed: XML is valid but could not be added to the installation media.
WIMUtil_Msg_ExtractDriversConfirm:
This will extract all third-party drivers from your current Windows installation and add them to the installation media.

This operation may take several minutes depending on the number of drivers installed.

Do you want to continue?
WIMUtil_Msg_DriversSuccess: System drivers have been extracted and added to the installation media. They will be automatically installed during Windows setup.
WIMUtil_Msg_DriverFilesAdded: Driver files have been added to the installation media and will be automatically installed during Windows setup.
WIMUtil_Msg_NoDriversFound:
No third-party drivers were found on your current system, or the extraction failed.

This can happen if:
 Your system only uses built-in Windows drivers
 The drivers are not exportable
 Insufficient permissions to export drivers

Convert to ESD format?

 Smaller ISO size (save ~{0} GB)
 Slower Windows installation

This process will take 10-20 minutes.

Continue?

Convert to WIM format?

 Faster Windows installation
 Larger ISO size (needs ~{0} GB more space)

Continue?

The installation of '{0}' could not complete, likely because Windows Updates are disabled.

WindowsApps_Msg_FallbackDownload:
The package '{0}' could not be found via WinGet, likely due to geographic market restrictions.

Winhance can download this package directly from Microsoft's servers using an alternative method (store.rg-adguard.net).

 The package files come directly from Microsoft's official CDN
 This method is completely legal and safe
 It bypasses regional restrictions only

Would you like to proceed with the alternative download method?

Setting_power-plan-selection_Description: Select the active power plan for your system
Dialog_AdvancedPowerWarning_Message:
This setting is not normally exposed in Windows Power Options and requires registry modifications to access.

Modifying it incorrectly may cause:
 System instability or unexpected behavior
 Performance degradation
 Thermal management problems
 Settings may not work on all CPU types (modern HWP vs legacy)

Only change this if you understand processor power management.

Are you sure you want to modify this setting?
Dialog_AdvancedPowerWarning_DontShowAgai: Don't show this warning again for advanced power settings
Setting_taskbar-copilot_Description: Show or hide the Copilot Preview button on the taskbar
Loading_PreparingApp: Loading apps and checking installation status...
Dialog_Choco_ConsentMessage:
The installation for this app failed via WinGet. Winhance can try to install it using Chocolatey, a trusted third-party package manager.

Chocolatey will be installed on your system if it isn't already.

Would you like to proceed?
Dialog_Choco_DontAskAgain: Don't ask me again (always use Chocolatey as fallback)
